poem:
### Sally Meets Hugh

Sally  
surprised—  
Hugh,  
human-sized,  

the world's stage  
casts shadows,  
expectations towering,  

but up close—  
the simple humility  
of skin and bone,  

a distant star  
brought near,  
no more than  
man.  

This encounter,  
a fleeting verse  
between the lines  
of fame.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sally Phillips: ‘I saw Hugh Grant and I screamed. I was surprised he was human-size’ What do people approach you about most: Smack the Pony, Bridget Jones, Alan Partridge or shoving cake into Alex Horne’s armpits? I profile them as they come up. If it’s a man about my age, it would normally be Alan Partridge. If it’s a man in his 30s, it might be Taskmaster or Veep. If it’s a woman, it’s harder". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
